definition: to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from

sentences.english: Joey falls while jumping on the bed and dislocates his arm.
sentences.chinese: 喬伊在牀上蹦蹦跳跳時把手摔到脫臼。

sentences.english: Work of the separate motorized rifle brigade dislocated in the Arctic Circle is far from being simple.
sentences.chinese: 在北極圈脫臼的獨立機動步槍旅的工作是很不簡單的。

sentences.english: Boulahrouz starts for the first time since dislocating his shoulder on 17 February.
sentences.chinese: 博拉魯斯自二月十七日肩膀脫臼後第一次首發。

sentences.english: Her ankle disjointed when she fell.
sentences.chinese: 她跌了一跤，腳踝脫臼了。

sentences.english: Nosoldiers were seriously hurt, beyond a separated shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 沒有士兵受重傷，除了一個肩膀脫臼。

sentences.english: She fell and put her knee out of joint.
Her dislocated shoulder was carefully manipulated back into place.
sentences.chinese: 她脫臼的肩關節經小心推拿而復位。

sentences.english: I was only back for three and a half weeks when DWade dislocated his shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 我回隊剛過三週半，韋德的肩膀就脫臼了。

sentences.english: Their hands were deviated over and twisted.
sentences.chinese: 他們的手都脫臼並且扭曲了“。

sentences.english: The joint of your left shoulder is dislocated.
sentences.chinese: 你左肩膀的關節脫臼了。

sentences.english: That first season at Arsenal I dislocated my shoulder in every game.
sentences.chinese: 在阿森納的第一個賽季，每一場比賽我都會脫臼。

sentences.english: A doctor can reduce a fracture or dislocation.
sentences.chinese: 醫生能使骨折或脫臼復原。

sentences.english: Boulahrouz plays for the first time since dislocating his shoulder in the last round.
sentences.chinese: 博拉魯斯自上一輪肩膀脫臼後，首次上場比賽。
平託的這種能力通常被稱做“眼球脫臼”。

pinyin: yao1 zhui1 jian1 pan2 tu1 chu1

definition: popliteal (anatomy)/hollow at the back of the knee
body palpation (diagnostic method in TCM)/tactile examination
to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to injure by scratching or clawing
